page.title: 09Shopping in Taddington
page.content: There is only one village shop in Taddington,which is also the post office.The shop sells many things besides groceries.Half day closing is on Mondays.Many older people buy all their groceries there but a lot of families visit the supermarkets at Buxton,Bakewell and Chesterfield. At one time travellers from Tideswell and Bakewell grocers took orders and the goods were delivered a few days later. The shop was a chapel until 1927. The old post office has been converted into a house.That too was a shop for many years.A bread van comes twice a week,a greengrocer on Tuesdays,and a fishmonger on Wednesdays.A van selling all kinds of foodstuffs also comes once a week.Milk is delivered daily by two firms.The butcher's shop closed down a few years ago and now fresh meat has to be bought elsewhere.
